### 1. Datetime conversion (TaskDatabase –∏ MonitoringDatabase):
```python
@staticmethod
def _datetime_to_str(dt: datetime | None) -> str | None:
    return dt.isoformat() if dt is not None else None

@staticmethod
def _str_to_datetime(s: str | None) -> datetime | None:

```

### 2. Connection context manager (–∏–¥–µ–Ω—Ç–∏—á–Ω—ã–π –∫–æ–¥ –≤ –æ–±–æ–∏—Ö –∫–ª–∞—Å—Å–∞—Ö):
```python
@contextmanager
def _connection(self) -> Generator[sqlite3.Connection, None, None]:
    conn = sqlite3.connect(self.db_path)
    conn.row_factory = sqlite3.Row
    conn.execute("PRAGMA foreign_keys = ON")
    try:
        yield conn
        conn.commit()
    except Exception:
        conn.rollback()
        raise
    finally:
        conn.close()
```

title: Add proxy health monitoring with auto-disable
description:
**Problem:**
Proxies have no health status. If proxy dies, sessions using it fail silently until user manually checks.

**Solution:**

**1. Proxy status field:**
Add status to ProxyEntry model:
- `working` - last ping successful
- `no_ping` - last ping failed, temporarily disabled
- `untested` - never tested (new proxy)

**2. Periodic health check:**
Background task every 5 minutes:
- Ping all proxies via TCP connect test
- Update status based on result
- Log warnings for failed proxies

**3. Auto-disable logic:**
- After 3 consecutive failures ‚Üí status=no_ping
- Proxy unavailable for new session assignments
- Existing sessions continue (they have their own error handling)
- Manual 'Retest' button in UI to check and re-enable

**4. UI indicators:**
In proxy list show:
- üü¢ Working (last ping: 2 min ago)
- üî¥ No ping (failed: 3x, last attempt: 1 min ago)
- ‚ö™ Untested

**5. Integration with sessions:**
When creating/editing session:
- Only show 'working' proxies in dropdown
- Show warning if selected proxy is 'no_ping'
close_reason: Released in v0.4.7

description:

- No dot indicator under dock icon

- AppTranslocation may break NSStatusItem initialization

4. Check if pystray NSStatusItem works when app is in quarantine

title: Fix read-only filesystem error for data directory
description:
**Error:**
```
Save Failed
Failed to create proxy: [Errno 30] Read-only file system: '/private/var/folders/.../AppTranslocation/.../data/config'
```

**Root cause:**
- macOS AppTranslocation moves downloaded .app to read-only temp location
- App tries to write to relative path inside app bundle
- data/config should use user's home directory, not app bundle

**Current behavior:**
- _is_path_in_readonly_location() detects this but only shows warning
- App continues trying to write to read-only location

**Fix:**
1. Auto-detect AppTranslocation on startup
2. Auto-switch data_dir to ~/Library/Application Support/ChatFilter when in read-only location
3. Remove manual --data-dir requirement
4. Show one-time migration notice if config exists in old location
close_reason: Released in v0.4.7

title: Fix tray icon and app not responding on macOS
description:
**Symptoms:**
- No tray icon appears in menu bar
- Dock icon bounces indefinitely, then shows 'Application Not Responding'
- Indicator dot (showing app is running) is absent
- However web interface works at localhost:8000

**Root cause hypothesis:**
1. pystray.run_detached() may block main thread on macOS with AppTranslocation
2. pyobjc (NSStatusItem backend) may fail silently in sandboxed environment
3. PIL/Image loading from app bundle may timeout

**Investigation needed:**
- Add try/catch with detailed logging around tray initialization
- Test if removing tray code fixes app responsiveness
- Check if AppTranslocation affects icon loading

**Fix approach:**
- Make tray initialization fully async with timeout
- Add graceful fallback if tray fails
- Log detailed errors for debugging

description:
## Problem
proxy_pool.py uses `get_application_path() / "data/config/proxies.json"` which fails on macOS AppTranslocation.

Error: `[Errno 30] Read-only file system: '/private/var/folders/.../AppTranslocation/.../ChatFilter.app/Contents/MacOS/data/config'`

## Root Cause
- `src/chatfilter/storage/proxy_pool.py:20-30` uses `get_application_path()` directly
- Rest of codebase uses `settings.config_dir` which resolves to `~/Library/Application Support/ChatFilter/config`
- main.py auto-relocates `settings.data_dir` but proxy_pool.py bypasses this

## Fix
Refactor `_get_proxies_path()` to use `settings.config_dir / "proxies.json"` instead of hardcoded relative path.

## Files
- src/chatfilter/storage/proxy_pool.py (lines 20-40)

## Impact
CRITICAL - users cannot add/edit/delete proxies on macOS
close_reason: Fixed: proxy_pool.py now uses get_settings().config_dir instead of get_application_path()

The batch_progress_callback function properly captures loop variables using default

- Line 960: current_chat_title: str = chat_title  (captures chat title by value)
